Tutorial Template

This "content.html" page provides a simple template for writing tutorial pages for the BigSQL website. If it's a long tutorial, include a table of contents

Table of Contents

  1. Creating Files
  2. Authoring Content
  3. Viewing Content
    1. Nested ToC
    2. ToC more indented

Creating Files

The first step is to copy this template and make it ready for your new tutorial.
  1. Copy the docs/template folder, and name the folder to match your tutorial.
  2. Rename the "template.jsp" file to match your tutorial as well (ex. "tutpllangs.jsp").
  3. Edit the page title, keywords, and description in the new .jsp
  4. Write your content in content.html following the simple html rules (replace all the content you are reading right now!!)
  5. Add any images to your new tutorial folder and reference them locally

Authoring Content

Use paragraph tags to write new paragraphs.

And for spacing between paragraphs if you want.

To include code or shell script examples use a <pre><code> tag cobmination

$ code you type would go here
Output from commands here
Other output here

And another paragraph or two could go here

You might also have some SQL code


postgres# CREATE EXTENSION postgis;
CREATE EXTENSION
postgres# select * from a_table;

Viewing Content

You can double click the content.html file to open in your webbrowser. It will look plain but have all the content and numbering in place.

If you want to see how the file will look on the bigsql site, you can run a local python web server in this folder:


  $ python -m SimpleHTTPServer

And then open your browser to point at the static wrapper file http://localhost:8000/staticwrapper.html

Smaller Header

Make as many sections as you need. Anchors can go on non-headers too.
